intro: Decaloba biflora var. mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican two-flowered decaloba, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
